column4: i just came in here to complain that there was a problem in the LTS release that might be "critical"   run-parts  doesn't work.
your best bet is to figure out what's wrong and then file a bug report on launchpad
my best bet is to rm the file and write a script to replace it....      i would fix it but,  i don't  C  :)
try removing the .sh from the filename
i'll just make a script with a for loop to run what ever is in the dir it's pointed at and be done with it.
i assume that run-parts being hosed is why the package manager was also acting stupid....
well, you should still report it -- not that it'll do any good, but that's the right thing to do :)
yeah someone should....     i'm just too irresponsable  and unregistered ....  i don't even have an email addy.
hmm, it's working for me so far
mine shows   Debian run-parts program, version 2.15.2
hmm -- i don't see anything in the changelog that talks about a bug
anyway, you could build the edgy package on LTS and see if that fixes the problem
it's provided by "debianutils"   i might try that.  in the mean time.  i'll make a script and get done with what i'm fiddling with...      thanks for the tod.
